newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-AGL says trading in line with budget.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-AGL says trading in line with budget.

text.p: Gas utility and energy group Australian Gas Light Co (AGL) said on Tuesday that trading to date in the year to June 30, 1997 was in line with budget.

"The record profit for 1995/96 was not a 'one-off' and the performance of the group in the current year to date is in line with AGL's profit predictions," chairman Richard Mason told shareholders at the annual meeting.
AGL reported a 32 percent rise in net profit of A$124.3 million for the year to June 1996.
AGL said in August after it announced its 1995/96 results it was targetting earnings growth of 10 percent.
At 10.40 p.m. (0040 GMT), AGL shares were 14 cents or 2.12 percent up at A$6.74 on a volume of about 53,500 shares.
